column4: Hey guys, I got a problem with Eclipse not loading. It shouldn't be something hard to answer, anyway here's a link to my thread with all the info: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=304443
'eclipse' is probably a script that sets $JAVA_HOME to the wrong spot
if you look at 'which eclipse' see if it's a script and set JAVA_HOME to where you installed 1.5
you tell me, it will tell you where 'eclipse' is
oh ok, didn't know it was a command. Here's the output:  /usr/lib/eclipse/eclipse
k, odd that's a binary file, I'm not sure why invoking it with full path works and without doesn't
brb, going to relogin using xchat (currently on chatzilla)
yeah not sure what your issue is, it's weird, I would just say to invoke it with the full path since it works
why not just run it with the full path?
yeah I will... sometimes just bothers me to have such simple bugs
it's not you though I think it's the bin for Eclipse is doing something odd with paths
you could run 'strace eclipse' and 'strace /path/to/eclipse' and see if there is anything interesting there
